summary.para: Adds a new range to the list of time ranges.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If the new range intersects a range already in the list, the two ranges are combined. Otherwise, the new range is added to the list.

summary.para: Clears the list of time ranges.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Queries whether a specified time falls within any of the time ranges.

returns.para: Returns TRUE if any time range contained in this object spans the value of the time parameter. Otherwise, returns FALSE.

remarks.para: This method returns TRUE if the following condition holds for any time range in the list:

summary.para: Gets the end time for a specified time range.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the time range to query. To get the number of time ranges, call .

param.name: pEnd
param.para: Receives the end time, in seconds.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the TimeRanges.end method in HTML5.

summary.para: Gets the number of time ranges contained in the object.

returns.para: Returns the number of time ranges.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the TimeRanges.length attribute in HTML5.

summary.para: Gets the start time for a specified time range.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the time range to query. To get the number of time ranges, call .

param.name: pStart
param.para: Receives the start time, in seconds.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the TimeRanges.start method in HTML5.

summary.para: Represents a list of time ranges, where each range is defined by a start and end time.

remarks.para: The IMFMediaTimeRange interface corresponds to the TimeRanges interface in HTML5.
